         Felecia held her mouth shut for a second while she processed the question. âI just want to know what âseaâ means so that I can keep up with the story, thatâs all.â She insisted.
         âAre you sure thatâs it?â Joseph inquired with mock enthusiasm. Joseph knew it was a dangerous gamble to pressure her, but he was confident that Felecia would blink before him. He gained a further confidence boost
         âI guess,â she mumbled, âit would be nice to know the context of what you said. I mean, is a sea really that deep and full? And besidesâ she whimpered, pushing her bottom lip out, âI wanted to know.â
         Joseph cursed Felecia. He knew what she wanted to ask but wouldnât. After finally finding the section in the book that talks about the sea, the only answer he could give to the unasked question was âyesâ.
         âYes.â Joseph responded, turning around to face Felecia. âEyes as deep and full as the sea does mean beautiful.â He looked down at the open pages of the book as he walked back to his place at her side. âThe passage goes on and on about how the sea sparkles. âBillions of fish in millions of colors can make the sea indistinguishable from a living rainbow.â Shame there arenât any in Naxia. Guess Iâll just have to make do with something just as good. âJoseph smiled. He knew that he had blinked first, but wasnât too sore about his loss.
1141111111111111111111111.title: The Beauty of the Sea

13.content:
Primary Objective - Explore your surroundings and find any other people.
Secondary Objective - Meet the people with you
Bonus - Try to make some clothes =-=

Martin...wake
"uh..." you groaned.
Wake... a mysterious female voice said again.
Your eyelids flew open instantly and you began to glance around. Everything felt...soggy, humid, and wet...almost like a sauna except with a stingy attitude towards it.
"Ah!" you heard a very loud and close scream to your right and immediately turned to find a girl staring at you frightened.
"Who the hell are you?! And why am I naked?!" the girl screamed.
You looked down and noticed you were naked...and plus, you were also in some sort of brush with her. You noticed she was a brown haired girl with a very nice, proportioned face, and...well-rounded assets.
"Uh...I'm...not sure...," you began trying hard not to stare at her body.
"Oh my god...did we..." she gasped clasping her hands over her mouth.
You instantly knew what she meant and you weren't exactly sure either.
"I'm not really sure..." you stated.
Before she would begin worrying frantically, another voice groaned. You both stood there frozen almost wondering who else may have been there and off near your leg, you saw another guy murmering in his sleep.
"No...no...pretty lady...leave me alone...you bitch...I know hung ho-*snore" he mumbled. A closer look revealed an asian dude with some glasses on. He looked to be a very smart person but as of this moment, it was quite the opposite.
"Okay...could someone please tell me where we are at?" Another female voice came in. Off near a tree, you saw a black, slim female with...unusually red hair. Once again, her body mesmerized you and you quickly pulled your erection back.
"You tell me..." the girl with you agreed.
"Okay okay, how about we all tell each other's name...it's obvious no one knows where we are at," you said.
The girls sighed and the asian dude continued to snore.
"My name is Zoey," the browned hair girl said.
"Trisha," the black female stated.
You looked over to the asian and started yelling. "Hey you! Wake up already!"
The asian instantly stood up dazed and confused. Zoey screamed as she saw the asian fully naked in front of her.
"God! Cover yourself up!" Trisha said.
The asian dude looked at the girls confused too tired to notice they, themselves are also naked.
"Whoa...what happened last night?" the asian dude asked.
You closed your eyes hoping that this was all come clear, you could remember nothing....nothing at all.
"Okay nevermind that...tell us your name already..."
The asian dude was so confused but so was everybody else. "Uh...Hikei," he replied.
"How about yours?" Zoey asked you.
"Martin," you replied.
"Okay...so, Martin and uh...Hecame?" she asked unsure.
Zoey couldn't help but laugh.
Hikei was slow at first but realized how much Trisha misspelled his name. "IT'S H-I-K-E-I!"
"Okay okay, sorry. It was a little mistake," Trisha said apologetically. She couldn't help but chuckle herself, "So I'm guessing you boys don't know anything?"
You wondered why it was being pointed towards the boys. "We swear, we don't know anything," you pledged.
"I wonder if there are any other people?" Zoey started too caught up in figuring out where she was.
Hikei's eyes widened, "My sister! I wonder if she's here?"
"Well...I guess we have to go find any other people." you said.
Trisha folded her arms which pushed against her breasts. You weren't sure how long you would be able to handle this. The asian guy didn't seem to care that much. "I'm not going anywhere until I find something to cover up. I can't have you or er...Hekai staring at us girls."
You flushed a bit embarrased. Hikei also was flushing.
13.title: Martin

131.content:
The girls immediately left away to find something to cover themselves up with. The problem was that they both had such a boldacious body that you weren't sure how they would be able to cover themselves up. You looked at yourself and shrugged. You had other issues to deal with such as finding any survivors. Maybe they could figure out what was going on.
You and Hikei started moving every minute almost forgetting the fact that they were both naked. It felt almost natural...kind of strange to think that guys like you and Hikei wasn't worried one bit and the girls were freaking about it. Then again...you were pretty sure that you'd get slapped especially by Trisha if they both saw you got an erection again.
You glanced over to Hikei who was walking along and staring at the trees almost as if he was in a trance.
"Hey dude, are you okay?" you asked.
He snapped back to reality. "Oh! Yeah man, just thinking about why were here...that's all," he explained.
"It's weird," you began, "You seem to acknowledge that you have a sister but for me, I can't remember anything at all."
He chuckled a bit, "I'm actually not sure but somewhere in my head says that I have a sister. I'm sure but I'm also not sure...all I know is that is the first person we have to find," he explained.
"Hmm..." you agreed.
You both stopped and looked at each other for a moment. "Dude...do you notice anything strange?" asked Hikei.
"Er...other than the fact we're both naked and calm...no..." you replied.
"If this is a jungle, should we be swarming with bug bits?"
You started to realize, for however long you had walked, there hasn't been a single bug in sight...or at least a bug bite.
"Look!" Hikei pointed. Your head turned and you saw a strange blue glowing.
"What the hell could that be?" you stated.
"My sister?!" he exclaimed.
You shook your head. "Um...no, I don't think so. Let's check it out."
You started to move towards the blue and saw...
131.title: Strange blue glow

Julie, age 16. Land: Femiscera. She awoke with a batch of 30 females onto a tropical island populated entirely by women. A previous Awakening 30 years ago created a thriving female society. While the absence of certain Fence sections grants them contact with a few lands, they have refused most diplomatic negotiations. This stems from their leaders’ teachings that women are superior to men. They maintain their population by buying the temporary services of strong males to impregnate volunteer mothers. Any boys born are sold to the other lands as slaves. How will Julie fare with signs of war on the horizon?
         Tristan, age 18. Land: Balgin. Waking in a marshy land in a batch of 16, half male and half female, the responsibility of leader falls upon Tristan as he is the eldest. He doesn’t know the first thing about survival or leadership, but he’ll have to learn fast if he wants his people to survive.
         Cindy, age 30. Land: Salfim. She was woken by the sound of exploding bombs and gun shots. The surrounding landscape is covered in wreckage and dead bodies. Fortunately you happen to be in a fox hole at the moment. However, there are 2 small children in the hole with you. Do you run or stay? Take the children with you or leave them behind?
         Sigmund, age 40. Land: Maldin. Sigmund awoke 32 years ago along with a batch of 50 others into a civilization that had already been established 100 years prior. He was adopted by a powerful couple that couldn’t have children of their own. He grew up educated and loved, until one day he was elected representative of his land in an alliance of over 40 lands. The alliance respects the sovereignty of each land, as long as there aren’t any universal injustices. The alliance also promised free trade and mutual protection of all member states.

143.content:
Primary Objective: Avoid injury, Find safe shelter
Secondary Objective: Save others
Bonus: Discover a way to end the fighting

         The sacred land of Salfim had once been deemed the home of the gods before the Awoken appeared and pestered them into ascending making it known that they would only return when the land was at peace.
The objective, although simple in its form was a perverse task due to the doubt that loomed over those who did not reside within the land. For this reasoning generation after generation fought over the possession of the land each leader claiming ancestry rights to the sacred Salfim.


         A tremendous explosion rock the small stones from the walls of the 3 foot deep trench. You open your eyes feeling the dirt covering your face and insistently try moving your arm to wipe it free. It seems frozen and you feel the cold slurry running over your naked skin and realize your lying nude in the mud. The site slowly begins to return to you, and you cannot but feel the fear run through you as you see the whizzing bullets fly over the trench. You feel a tingling in your arm and suddenly the ability to move returns. Wiping the mud from your face you glance down the trench at the sight of awoken regain consciousness. Still in a daze and their senses crippled, they make their way to their feet unaware of the sounds of the fighting overhead they stand shortly before a strew of bullets drops them.
         The faint sound of children crying snaps your attention forward as your hearing slowly returns. The two children sit next to there mother less than four feet away. Cautiously you craw over to them and look down to the mother. Blood gushes her neck and her eyes are pale in the arms of a daughter which you guessed could be no more then 10. Sitting next to her is a 6 year old boy tears coursing down his dirty face who is looking around frantically.
         An echoing vibration rumbles the walls of the trench as a shadow looms over some awoken less than 100 feet from you. The tank rolls over the trench en-casing mud onto those below before turning and dropping the track down into the 3 foot deep rut. It crawls forward slowly the sound of screams heard slightly between the screeching of the tracks.
         You look down at the children then look back behind you at the sound of someone yelling. A man in a mud covered uniform screams at you once again holding open a small door. You look back at the children and take the hand of the 6 year old boy and pull at him. Without thought he grabs onto his sister, and she kicks at you.
         "Come with me, I can take you somewhere safe" You claim not knowing what is behind the door.
         The girl clings onto her dead mother and shrieks at you in disgust. Looking at her, you catch sight of the tank as it approaches less than 30 feet from the girl. You realize you may be able to snatch the boy away but as your thinking the girl wraps her arms around the mother's neck tightly. You look back at the door and the man with a look upon his face that reads leave them.

1432.content:
You reach down and grasp onto the boy's hand. He looks at his sister and reaches for help before tripping. You proceed pulling the sight of the tank looming closer and manage your way inside the small door.
"Let go" The young boy cries at you his arm aching and legs covered in mud. You ignore his demand and pull him inside as the walls begin to shake. The man you have seen before slams the doorway shut quickly then looks at you with a vivid expression of rage. The door is thrust open before a slurry of stained dirt comes tumbling in sealing any resemblance of a passage way. You hunch down in the narrow tunnel a wooden pilar pressing against your shoulder. The sight of a cluster of flickering lights hanging off of bracing draws your attention before the tunnel turns. You glance down at the young boy who stares at the pile where the door use to be and try to muster a response.
"What the hell were you thinking?" The man screams cutting your thought of remorse.
"I just thought that..." You say looking down at the boy as his eyes begin to well up with tears.
"You didn't think; do you have any idea? What will happen if they locate us" The man asks then looks down at the boy and sighs? The man looks around and begins walking away from you mumbling to himself.
You shove the boy ahead of you towards the man, and he follows. He quickly becomes silent except a few whimper as he walks. Covering up your nakedness you have many questions running through your head. Not knowing where you're going of how you got here. Why people were shooting and so on. You walk forward before being stopped by the feeling of something sharp as it dives into your foot. You screech out involuntarily pulling your foot up the sound radiating off of the walls. The man glares back at you as he stops.
"Be careful where you step, and hurry up, were not the only ones moving through these passages" He utters descending further down into the tunnel the boy walking behind as if he was told. Pulling your foot up you see a shard of metal exposed within your footprint as it shimmers off the lights above.
"Hurry up" The man shouts before turning down the tunnel, his and the boys shadows dancing off the wall.
You look down at the shard then.
1432.title: The Passageway

14321.content:
Primary Objective: Avoid injury, Find safe shelter
Secondary Objective: Get clothed
Bonus: Discover a way to end the fighting

You drop to your knees and briskly scratch at the object through the mud. Drawing at it tightly you suddenly feel it break loose and find the remains of a broken blade as you wipe the mud free.
"Well look at what we have here." A man says a few feet away. In all the confusion, you did not even notice him. Looking up you notice that he is clothed in soldiery fatigues like the man with the boy yet there is a flint in his eye that he is not looking forward to helping you.
"You should know better than to hang around these caverns alone. There are threatening people about." He says looming over you before snatching you up by your hair and pushing you against the wall of the cavern. You try to scream out but are deadened as his hand comes hard against your face. You feel him fumbling with his belt as his other hand now pushes against your neck. Your hand tightens around the blade involuntary and the pain it causes reminds you of its existence.
Without a second thought, you strike the blade forward sending it into the mans side. He lurches sideways catching his balance and begins reaching for a gun within the holster at his side.
14321.title: Threatening people about

choices: Go towards the man with the boy
143212.content: You move over quickly noticing as he brings the gun from the holster and swoop the knife across his neck. He gurgles out protest and falls to his knees. His eyes stare up at you in a blank expression until he slams down face forward in the dirt. You look around the cavern and at the man. Turning him over you feel the warm blood still gushing over his neck as you unbutton his shirt. The belt is pulled free and then the boots before finally the pants are slipped off the now corpse. You quickly pull on the pants and slip your bare feet into the boots your reluctant because of all the blood but slip on the shirt feeling the warm blood stick to your breast. You slip the belt through the pants feeling as the supplies inside and on the belt hang off your frame then look down the hallway.
143212.title: Clothes

145.content:
Rachel, age 15. Land Emberdan. Emberdan is a Medieval style kingdom, complete with stone castle, a peasant village and surrounding farm land. In her diverse batch of 256, Rachel is the only child. She has scarlet hair, brown eyes, is small for her age, and a budding chest. Another distinguishing factor about little Rachel is that while her fellow Residents are strewn across the town houses and halls of the castle, wearing attire appropriate to their location, she awakes most uncomfortably on the throne, wearing robes that match her scarlet hair and a jeweled crown on her head. Can she make a decent queen for her land, and more importantly does she want to?
         Cornelius, age 21. Land: Vane. He has Awoken in what seems to be a batch of 30 within a 1930s style bunker. These 30 seem to be divided into groups of 3 according to their clothing and ethnicity. Each group sports a military uniform from a different place and time, complete with era appropriate gear, weapons, and a face and attitude to match. These soldiers include Medieval Knights, Cornelius within the British Red Coats, Japanese Samuri, Roman Legionnaires, and the 3 women are United States Marines. Though the bunker seems more than well stocked, the land outside is unmistakably a battlefield, and something is out there.
145.title: Queen To Be, Or a Guy in a Trench

1452.content:
Since you have chosen Cornelius, feel free to fill in the remaining 5 groups with whatever types you wish, or if the group seems too large then just edit them out.
         If you choose to keep the 5 extra groups, try to make them reasonably diverse. My original concepts for the other groups were Chinese Boxers, Persian Immortals, Assyrian Bow Men, Incan Bola Throwers, Zulu Iklwa Warriors
1452.title: Cornelius, The Guy In The Trench

1453.content:
Keera, age 24. Land: Obnase. Awaking in a batch of one, a brown haired Asian girl has found herself on a small blanket in the center of a grass hut. It has been 30 years since the last Awakening and the once peaceful tribes of this land have erupted into civil war. No one knows who fired the first arrow. The only thing for certain is that Keera has appeared exactly on the 30th anniversary of the previous Awakening. Keera is the only one of her ethnicity in a fairly homogenous (South American) society.
         Megan, age 26. Land: Baldram. She has wide hips, blue eyes, brown hair, but what makes her stand out most is her height. She’s just south of 9ft tall and has a killer figure. To the best of her knowledge, her only other associates are a normal sized 16 year old boy and a normal sized 17 year old girl, whom she loves very much. They live together in a luxury cabin in the middle of a tropical jungle with plenty of fruit, easy to catch animals, few visible predators, electricity, and all the time in the world to spend with one another. Further, Megan has other notable traits besides her height.
1453.title: Asian Or Amazon

14532.content:
Primary Objective: Ensure that no one is killed by local predators. Survive for 2 years.
Secondary Objective: Discover the true cause of Megan’s problems.
Bonus: Stop the predators once and for all.

Do we begin at the beginning, or 6 months later.
14532.title: Super Hot Amazon Named Megan

145321.content:
The forest was alive with noon songs. The insects chirped and birds tweeted from the tops of the rustling trees. The last remnants of the morning dew fell from the tips of leaves down to the forest floor. The grass shook as animals of all shapes and sizes stalked, scurried, and foraged. The gentle lapping of a nearby stream flowed into a nearby pond filled with the croaking of rainbow frogs. Even the fish of the stream released bubbles from their lips as if to add to the chorus of the forestâ€™s ode to life.
         The great, golden sun shined its rays upon a grateful figure who welcomed the warmth. The figure also welcomed the raysâ€™ revealing qualities as they showed a still distortion in the tall grass. The contorted shape of a moderately sized being lay upon the forest floor.
         As the mysterious figure approached with the utmost stealth, not wanting to alert any unwelcome predators, the large figure took the time to examine the person in the grass. The being appeared to be in its late teens and just over five feet tall. An exact measurement was difficult due to it being contorted in a fetal position. The being had short brown hair, a well toned figure, and a limp extremity hanging from between its legs.
         The mysterious figure might have continued to examine the boy, were it not for his stirrings. Gently swinging his arm over, the boy narrowly avoided contact with the mysterious figure, which cautiously pulled back. As the boy tossed itâ€™s head from side to side, the mysterious figure knew that he was waking up. It knew it had to act quickly to avoid being seen.
         Will it be seen?
145321.title: The Beginning

choices: They flee the unknown intruders and head north into the swamp.
They go south seeking refuge in the city only to be hunted.
145322.content:
Megan stared across the table and smiled as her two guests happily ate the meal she had both caught and prepared for them. She enjoyed their company, since she had been completely alone until she found them wandering helplessly in her part of the jungle. When she found them they were without shelter during a powerful thunderstorm and looked like they haven't eaten in days, she has taken care of them ever since. They were lucky that it was her that found them and not a big cat or poisonous snake. They also happened to be in the relatively safe part of the jungle that Megan called home.

Neighboring this oasis of safety was a hostile world. To the south the jungle grows denser and is populated with predators, until the jungle suddenly stops and massive metal and glass structures climb into the sky, she knew the area was populated because the spires would light up at night from electric lights, like the ones in her home, but because of a gut feeling of dread and the alien look of the buildings she stayed away. To the north was a different matter. After a weeks journey through a inhospitable swamp the jungle was filled with an evil amazon tribe, that would kidnap any that dared enter their land, or so Megan had seen.

What she had also seen was that the hunters of the amazon tribe were only 6 feet tall at best, suggesting that Megan was the tallest person in the land at 9 feet high. Megan also saw that the amazons wore animal skins around their chests and over their pelvic areas, as opposed to herself, Kate, and Mark lacking any such fabrics to cover themselves.

In these last months she has learned much about her guests, they were both barely adults with Kate just a year older than Mark. Kate was like Megan in having dark hair and deep blue eyes, though being much smaller and standing only 5 and a half feet tall. Kate looked up to Megan wanting to be as strong and independent as the amazon and hardly left her side. Her brother, as Kate referred to him, was taller than Kate and had short black hair, though having only seen a few Amazons, the first thing Megan noticed was that Mark was unlike herself and Kate. She later concluded that there were probably other males like him in the city to the south, and that there wouldn't be any in the amazon ruled jungle, although she still couldn't figure out what males were for.

Megan stared of into space at the table, reflecting on the time the three had spent together, fishing, hunting, teaching them how to survive, and just staring up at the night sky looking at the stars. She is suddenly brought back into reality by a loud bang in the distance. Megan ran out of the cabin and onto the deck and scanned the horizon to the south. the sky was lit up with fire and columns of smoke towered into the sky. After a few moments another bang echoed through the jungle and another fire appeared, this one closer than the last. As the night went on the sound of explosions and fleeing animals filled the air, and the fires grew closer. Megan held Kate and Mark close as the two watched the inferno.

Kate looked up to Megan and in a confused voice asked, "What's going on? What's causing all this?"

"I think it's the people to the south, clearing the area to expand were going to have to leave the area it won't be safe for much longer. The only question is where should we go." Megan said as she carefully considered her options.
145322.title: Six Months Later

choices: A unnaturally large panther pounces on the group.
The group is being stalked by a humanoid in a full environmental protection sui
1453221.content:
"Garb your spears and meet me out front we need to leave before they get here." Megan said as she scanned the horizon once more before leaving the deck.

Kate grabbed her spear and ran to the front room of the cabin with Megan and waited for Mark. "So where are we going to go?" Kate asks obviously frightened by the situation.

Megan grabs Kate and pulls her close, her head barely reaching half way up Megan's chest. Megan embraced Kate tightly and comforted her. "Stay calm Kate, if you lose your nerve you won't make it far. We're going to follow the animals' lead and head north, then look for a new home after we cross the swamp. This is dangerous territory so I need you to stay strong for me."

Kate stared into Megan's deep blue eyes and was filled with hope from the confidence in the amazon's expression. " I'll be strong for you." Kate said, the fear in her voice now replaced admiration.

The two women break their embrace just as Mark enters the room. Megan motions towards the door and they take the first steeps of their long journey. Outside they are greeted by a completely different world. Smoke clouds their vision, with what little they can see tinted in a red hue from the fires. The peaceful sound of birds now replaced by the screaming and growling of animals and an metallic inhuman screech growing louder. Megan lead the group away from the fire, walking at first then frantic sprinting as the screech grew closer and closer. Moving north was difficult with no cleared path the group was forced to push through dense jungle, resulting in minor bruises and cuts on their bare skin. After clearing a few miles of rough terrain and climbing a steep hill the group turn around and and look at their former home. Near the cleared land, that the cabin was built on, the tip of a metal object could be seen above the tree line. The object slowly walked into the clearance, each step causing the earth to shake slightly. The object now stood exposed, A large spherical body held up by six large spider like legs, a portion of the sphere opened revealing a large blue crystal. The crystal glowed bright and in a flash a red beam of light appeared and scorched the earth everywhere it touched. The group watches in awe as their home is devoured by fire. They were so entranced that they failed to notice as a large figure slowly creep towards them.
1453221.title: They flee the unknown intruders and head north...

14532211.content:
As the group watched the mechanical being burn the jungle, a large black panther watched them from the shadows. Megan had unknowingly lead the group straight into the panther's territory. Unlike the other animals this predator held its ground against the advancing threat, and considered the group's trespassing an act of aggression. It moved slowly and silently until it was within striking range. Letting out a low growl the panther pounced. Megan heard the growl and turned around, and she saw the beast leaping through the air towards Mark, with little time to act Megan was able to knock Mark out of the way. Mark was now safe, however Megan was now in the panther's path. Megan hit the ground with a loud thud, as her vision focused she saw the beast's massive maw lowering towards her. Megan quickly jabs the wooden shaft of her spear on the panther's neck to keep its razor sharp teeth away.

Adrenaline pumped through Kate as she watched the powerful amazon struggle underneath the panther's weight. Kate let out a roar of primal fury and ran to Megan's aid, driving her spear into the panther's neck. The panther recoiled in pain, giving Megan an opening to kick the colossal beast off her. The panther cried out in pain before returning to its feet and darting away. Now standing in clear sight for the first time the group saw the behemoth in all it glory, standing as tall as Megan showing teeth that could easily be larger than a normal man's face. Megan picked herself up off the ground just as the panther circled around readying itself for another attack. The beast jumped through the air once more, but this time Megan was prepared, she dropped to one knee and thrust her spear forward causing the beast to impale itself. The spear drove straight through the panther's chest striking the heart and killing it immediately.

"Megan are you alright?" Mark asked as he ran to help her up.

"Yes, I'm fine thanks to Kate, she is turning into quite the amazon." Megan said while smiling at Kate.

Kate's face turns red and she averts her eyes away from Megan. "... I... just didn't want you to get hurt."

After dusting herself off, Megan once more leads the group north wanting to stay as far away from whatever the machines from the south. The next few days pass without incident, but as they reach the border of the swamplands they come across the remains of a camp site. The fire pit is cold and empty, only one tent stands, wrecked though it may be, yet marks on the ground indicate more tents once stood, the most disturbing image however is the drag marks and trail of dry blood that start from the wrecked tent.

"What happened here?" Mark asked as he raised his spear.

Megan held her spear tight and slowly followed the trail of blood. " I'm not sure just be rea...... oh my god." Megan finished. At the end of the drag marks the half eaten carcass of a man laid on the ground still rotting, tightly clenching a book in its hands.

Kate puts her hand over her mouth in disgust, but overcomes the gruesome sight and retrieves the book. "It's a diary, detailing a trip into a cave down the road." Megan said while pointing then began reading from the last entries in the book. " Day five and we're still lost, we thought this could be a safe route past the marsh of the dead, but its a damn labyrinth down here and I fear we are going in circles. Took make matters worse some of the guys are losing their grip on reality, claiming to see a monster stalking us its probably just the near black lighting playing tricks on overactive imaginations. Day six, We should leave, we should turn back and exit the way we came in, but something is drawing me in, A voice in the back of my head calling to me from the center of this maze. I'm seeing it now too and hearing a growl, It's watching us waiting for a moment to strike. I shouldn't be taking my eyes away from the shadows even to write, but I find it is the only thing that can calm my nerves. Day seven, oh god oh god, their dead all of them, I know it. It sprang from the shadows and started to rip us apart, and ... and I ran, I just left them. The only thing keeping me going is a light in the distance I must reach it. Day eight, I've made it out, I'm safe now. However it's as I feared I came out the way we entered, and whats worse I can still feel that thing's eye burning into my soul, watching me, waiting. " At this point Kate looks up with a grim look and said " This next part is written in his own blood....., It followed me out, and started to eat me alive, before leaving me to die a slow painful death. I write this now as a warning to all that may find this, if you go into it's lair it will never stop hunting you... Abandon hope all ye who enter here."

"The marsh of the dead, that's what the swamp is called! So are choices are this swamp of the dead or, from how that book describes it, the gates of hell, that's just wonderful." Mark says hysterically.

After seeing the gruesome corpse Megan wanted nothing to do with the cave, but just like the dead man, a voice in her head beckoned her to enter.
14532211.title: A unnaturally large panther pounces on the gro...

choices: A spear held by an Amazon.
145322111.content:
Megan placed her hand on Mark's shoulder and said, "Don't worry the swamp is dangerous, but it's nothing like this". Megan takes one last look at the body, before leading everyone away from the cave and towards the marshland. As they get closer to the swamp, the jungle becomes less dense until it reaches the point where the only vegetation is patches of tall grass and everything became silent after they reached the border of the swamp. Fog clouded their vision, but from what they could see showed how inhospitable the landscape was. The water was murky and near black, and it was devoid of life, with the exception of plants Megan recognized as poisonous. Megan walks into the murky water and continues forward with ease, but for Mark and Kate the water reached their waists. Mark kept his spear ready to strike, and attempted to scan the water as he moves.

"I don't like this the fog is limiting our visibility and the water is to dark to see into. Anything could be out here." Mark said quietly in case anything dangerous was near by.

"No I've crossed this swamp before nothing lives here. The swamp's water is toxic if you drink it, so there are no crocodiles, panthers or anything else out here. Are biggest danger here is dehydration so speed is more important than defense here." Megan said before picking up her pace. Mark lowered his spear and speed up to keep up with Megan.

"So when did you come through here Megan, I mean you haven't left our side since you found us. How long ago was it?" Kate asked as she speed up so that she could walk side by side with Megan.

"I'm not sure exactly when, but it was as far back as I could remember. I just woke up remembering barely anything, I only knew my name and that I wasn't always like this." Megan said motioning to her body.

"So you didn't always have that amazing amazon body." Kate said shortly before turning red, realizing how her statement could be interpreted.

Megan looked down at her young companion and smiled innocently before continuing her story. "No, but I'm not sure what changed me. Then shortly after gaining consciousness I was hunted through the jungle by other amazons. They finally stopped chasing me when I reached the swamp".

The group presses forward as Megan details how she crossed the marsh, explored the jungle and, built her home. Three days have passed and the three continued to struggle forward despite their lack drinkable water. At this point even the disgusting, black, murky water seemed welcoming, the only thing holding the group back was the knowledge that drinking it would cause an agonizing death. The thirst had lead to conflict in the group, Mark having grown angry at the situation blamed Megan for taking them into the swamp. Kate stood up for Megan leading to the two to grow distant and causing the group to continue in tense silence. As the group approached a sandbar Mark saw something small dart through the water and over a near by hill. "I just saw something over there." Mark said raising his spear," if we catch it it will help us a little." Megan and Kate nodded and followed Mark over the hill on the sandbar. As the three cleared the top of the hill they moved right into a pool of quicksand, and were quickly pulled in up to their chests. The three struggled but they soon realized they couldn't get free on their own. Then when the group seems to have lost all hope, a wooden object is lowered to their arms. One by one they grab on and are pulled out, Megan looks up at their savior and sees that the wooded stick was.
145322111.title: Water, water everywhere.

14533.content: Jerry, age 17. Land: Mog. He is a mediocre teenager from multiple nationalities. Jerry awakes along with a group of what appears to be eight others, but there are likely more. Mog is set in a 21st century suburban district, complete with stores, houses, a couple of parks, and thousands of dead bodies. The streets and even many of the buildings are filled with week old corpses. There are no obvious signs of conflict (aside from panicking masses) or building damage, but there is little doubt that whatever force responsible for the deaths of these people may still be lurking in the shadows.
14533.title: Maybe a Post Apocalyptic Place

145332.content: The New Kid, age 19 or older. Land: Dremp. The New Kid may be either a boy or girl and they are joined by about six or seven additional new Residents. The world consists of a fairly large sized high school surrounded by about twenty suburban homes. One year prior to the arrival of the new Residents there was an Awakening of approximately 300 humans that range in age from eight to sixteen. Girls make up a minority of this group. The situation of this world is on the verge of meeting Lord of the Flies.
145332.title: How About The New Kid?

1453321.content:
Primary Objective: Establish a new chain of command.
Secondary Objective: Set yourself as leader.
Bonus: Kill/Save Someone



So you want to be a new kid.
Dude or Duddet?
After this you can be whatever you want.
1453321.title: The New Kid

choices: John is caught in the storm.
1453322.content:
John Lazarus, a strong young man with short black hair, opened his eyes, revealing their gentle blue color to find that he had awakened in a place he did not recognize. It was morning and he was resting on a low cliff, over looking a fertile valley, devoid of any human life.

"Where am I?" he asked himself.

John with the heart of an adventurer and the mind of an explorer looked about for a moment then searched his memory, trying to retrace his steps to determined how he came to be there but nothing came to mind, it was all a blank, as if everything before this day did not exist. Trying not to panic, he searched for his pockets to find he did not have any, he was wearing very simple clothing, made up of animal skins.

"Well, this is problem." he thought, looking around again.

He looked up to a rumbling sound and found that a storm was brewing in the far distance, he would have to find shelter before the storm reached him, otherwise, he would be in for a worse day than he woke up to.

"I better get moving." said John, working his way off the small cliff. "I'm not going to find any answers standing around."
he sighed, walking towards the valley. "There's bound to be clues around somewhere that will tell me where I am." he assured himself. "I just have to keep my eyes open."

With that, John walked off, into his new surroundings, using only what seemed right in respects of survival to find some shelter before the storm...
1453322.title: John Lazarus

14533221.content:
Coming across a few fallen trees, John saw a potential shelter. Without really thinking about it, he looked about, finding some lengths of sturdy vine and used them to tie the narrow trees closer together to form a roof for a lean to. He then lifted the three fallen trees with his back, just enough, to get them onto two large stumps close by.

"That should do it." he said to himself. "Now for some dry grass and some wood before that storm hits so I don't freeze my butt off tonight."

Gathering the grass and, twigs, and small branches that were lying about, John got back to the lean to, just in time to beat the rain as it began to come down in buckets. John then an old trick of rubbing sticks together to make a small fire, again without really thinking about it. Thunder rumbled overhead as John laid down next to the small fire, thankful that he was able to find shelter in time.

"Tomorrow, I will have to find some food and water." he said to himself. "Otherwise, I am not going to last long in this strange place, where ever it is."

John watched the storm rage overhead and got the idea of catching some of the water but he had no idea how he was going to do it...
14533221.title: John finds/makes shelter in time.

15.content:
Alexander, age 23. Land: Grond. Unlike others who simply woke up, Alexander was born. He was conceived by a fairly wealthy couple in a civilization over 200 years old. The population is large but education is restricted only for the wealthiest of merchants. Everyone else is either a servant or a menial worker. Grond is a vast valley that lies in a crossroads of several other lands, making it a prominent land of trade. However, Alexander, son of a merchant couple, has never been content at the bartering table. Instead, he has always had a talent for rallying people with overwhelming speeches, and he’s not too bad with a sword.
         Vivian, age 13. Land: Sandris. It is not surprising that after her people woke up 50 years ago that there would be some children. She lives in a desert society where resources are few, due to their lack of contact with other lands. She is now of age where girls where many girls are to be married off. Will she comply with tradition, and if so, what will her new husband be like?
         Rosh, age 17. Land: Dren. Not quite human, Rosh is actually half Glame. The Glame have humanoid bodies with blue lines along their extremities, slit eyes, and 8 stubby horns along their bald scalps. Because both Glame and humans woke up 60 years ago, and worked together to build civilization, the Glame have equal rights within their own land. However, as the Glame have not appeared in any other land that the Dren people are in contact with, they are not so well treated by foreigners. Rosh has human and Glame friends, but how long can his life of peace last while being surrounded by bigots?
15.title: How About Some Born Choices

choices: she waits all night and no one comes
152.content:
Vivian woke early to watch the sun rise. today was her wedding day was promised to him at birth. she was nervous Vivian lay on the marriage bed waiting on her husband to be's approval if he did not approve she would be sent out in to the desert live as a hermit. she had lived here in this room since she was five. twice a day food was brought. in the morning a basin of water and soap were provided for her to wash her self in the evening a bucket was brought for her to relieve herself. the bucket was brought with evening meal taken a way with the morning dishes.

Vivian resists the urge to look up from her bowed position. she had been instructed repeatedly that doing os was a sign of arrogance and will lead to her immediate dismissal.
152.title: Vivian

choices: he takes her right there on the floor
he asks her to make love to his chief  wife
he leaves without saying a word
1521.content:
After what seems like an eternity of waiting she feels a mans hand gently grab her chin and gently but firmly lift up her head until she was looking in the eye. He had kind eyes but other wise his face hard to read. He had a scar extending from the corner of his right eye to his right ear. He smiled at her but his smile was lopsided.
he did a cursory inspection of her body. then he does something unexpected...
1521.title: her husband comes

choices: Vivian does as she is told
15212.content: Vivian looks up to see a man and a woman enter her cell. the man is her husband to be. the woman is clearly someone of importance because she is well dressed and clean and very fat. Vivian waits for the man take her but instead the woman speaks "the marriage contract has been voided instead you belong to me. if you please me, you will be my bed warmer. if this cell will become your tomb. now make love to me"
15212.title: he asks her to make love to his chief  wife

155.content:
Velfavor, age 12. Land: Devben. Hers is a species of leathery green skin; slit yellow eyes, pointed ears, long scrawny extremities, and 4 fingers on each hand, an average height of 7 feet, high intelligence, and low physical strength. Her batch is composed of 4 Albin (including herself) and 16 humans, with a total gender ratio of 1:1. Devben appears to be a futuristic city composed of exactly 7 skyscrapers. The Residents are all located on one of the central floors of the central building, which they believe to be some kind of hotel. As such, many of their physical needs are accounted for by the futuristic technology. The only real problem seems to be that the elevators don’t work and the emergency staircase is locked.
         Goldfang, age 19. Land: Moldinisa. He is an 8ft tall western dragon with silver scales, golden teeth and claws, wings, and an especially short snout. His is a batch composed of 8 dragons, 12 elves, and 30 humans. They have all awoken within the depths of an underground tunnel system that appears to have been an old mine. Most of the tunnels are large enough for the dragons to move through but only the main chamber allows them to stretch their wings. Fortunately there seems to be enough air, mushrooms, and broken water pipes to keep them nourished, at least for a while.
155.title: Nonhuman Choices

1553.content:
Delbang, age 18. Land: Vershtae. Delbang is a humanoid who has yet to choose its gender in life. It has an athletic body, above average height, the greenest of green eyes, and a few mysterious abilities. Vershtae consists of farmland, a few lakes, a large forest, and a fairly generic medieval village. The preachers at the local church have foretold the coming of a savior who would lead them beyond the Great Wall. If the preachers believe Delbang to be this savior, they may do anything and everything in their power to control him.
         Safame, age 21. Land Brage. Safame is a naga woman 10ft from head to ground. She has large D cup breast, full lips, and blue eyes as deep as any sea. Her light green skin and dark green hair and scales grant her excellent camouflage in the jungle that is Brage. Scattered throughout this land are a dozen or so villages of varying sizes with a walled city in the middle. The settlements are occupied by highly superstitious humans who may regard Sefame as a blessing or a curse. Fortunately, these are issues that must be dealt with in the future. The present however, has a much more pressing issue: a nagaâ€™s hunger.
1553.title: The Neuter or the Naga

15532.content:
Primary Objective: Hunt, Make Contact With the People, and Survive for Ten Years
Secondary Objective: Make a Friend, Fight off a Threat
Bonus: Become a Leader

         The forest was unusually quiet that night. The beasts did not howl and the birds did not sing their night songs. In a sizable clearing about halfway between the northern-most village of Kadar and Mt Zen, a beam of light from the full moon shined upon Brage’s latest Resident.
         Local beasts looked out from their various shelters and stared in wonder at this great shining mass. Her movement was so subtle and her sounds so quiet that it wasn’t long before all manner of beasts moved into the clearing for a better look. Most of her body was covered in glistening scales, but atop her snake like coils rested the equally familiar shape of a human.
         A distant rustle in the brush caused the animals to scramble back for cover. A band of humans were moving through the forest. With an abundance of nocturnal dangers in Brage, there were only so many reasons for humans to travel at night and most weren’t exactly pleasant. In any case, their collective voices were causing the naga to stir.
         Who do you follow?
15532.title: A Naga Called Sefame

15533.content:
Wolf, age 17.
Land Okami. Wolf is a Ookami male, he about 5'9", blood color ruby eyes, he covered in light gray fur, and darker gray for hair. As Ookami is a wolf demon that resembles a wearwolf, but with magical powers.
Okami is a strang jungle, but certainly no paradise. There are a few vilages here and there, but nothing to amazing, unless you count the mysterious walled city. The people of the towns are a mix of races including humans and an assortment of humanoid furrys. Wolf's shape may not stand out, but his powers may earn him quite a bit of attention. Only time will tell if that is a good thing or a bad thing.

How about this?
15533.title: Perhaps a wolf named Wolf

Secondary Objective: Kill another living creature
Bonus Objective: Make a knife or some other manner of weapon

Now, where to begin?

info.brief_description: A game where the players know that they are playing. Add to mine and I'll add to yours.
info.description:
If you add a quality chapter to this story then I will do the same for one of yours.

Think of the following as game instructions.


Keep in mind that this is a giant game. The players are not aware they are playing and aren’t allowed to find out unlit a story has achieved a sufficient length. Whatever force or forces controlling the game are generally referred to by the inhabitants as gods.
The beginning of each level (not chapter) has a display of the game’s primary objectives. Completion of the objectives and bonus challenges awards the players with some manner of prize or prizes and an increase in overall difficulty. The nature of bonus challenges is hidden from players. Players may only be faintly aware of their game objectives, like a voice in the back of their heads.
Completing an objective and winning a prize isn’t as obvious as hearing “Blue Team, Flag Returned”, and having a crate fall from the sky. It is often the case that an immediate prize is indistinguishable from the normal environment. In some cases the prize might simply be the unlocking of the next objective or perhaps nothing more humble than an idea. Residents may receive prizes for completing the same objective multiple times, with the nature of the prize reflecting the nature and severity of the specific objective accomplished. For example, if the objective is to find food, the award for killing and eating a small animal is less substantial than cultivating a plant for food.

Every now and then, one or more people wake up in a strange land with no memories of their lives beforehand, if they ever existed. In some cases with those who appear, there are some residual memories. Nothing about their personal lives; these memories refer to general things such as the concept of electricity, how to use most household tools and appliances, and perhaps something about the land they awoke in.
The number of people who appear in any given Awakening has been known to vary anywhere from 1 to 1000. There is no consistent pattern in regards to the nature of those who awaken; with one exception, since all inhabitants of a single land speak the same language. The only thing anyone ever remembers is their own name. Most people who awake are not blank slates. They have personalities, fears, values, and desires that reflect whatever world or era they might have come from. This does not mean that all new Residents are from 21st century Earth. New Residents may hale from any place or time in the known or unknown universe.
Those who wake are not always human since animals of various species have been known to wake up alongside people. Some people who wake aren’t entirely human. These non humans tend to be in the minority of whatever land they live in. All humans and non human people are genetically compatible, allowing the possibility for mix breeding.
It is also common for more than one Awakening to occur in a single land. The time between Awakenings can be anywhere from 1 to 400 years. Those that appear in a land are called Awoken while those who are born are called Born. All Awoken people have some pre existing knowledge of some mysterious gods. This knowledge rarely goes beyond simply being aware of their existence and the fact that they created the lands.
Each land varies in population capacity, pre existing buildings, tools, and various resources, vegetation, wildlife and weather patterns. The size of the lands varies from a few acres to a large island. Some lands are completely devoid of sentient life and exist only to be given away as prizes, but all lands are capable of sustaining some human life. The lands are all sealed off from one another by enormous metal walls with a 50ft shield of energy above them that prevents anyone from seeing over them. All attempts to peak over the Fences have resulted in that section of wall drastically increasing in height to prevent any looky lues.
Sometimes a section of the Fence disappears, allowing lands to make contact with one another. Once lands are connected, their weather patterns mesh together and new resources are awarded to both lands. The space where fences used to stand is quite obvious as, for example: jungle dirt drastically ends and becomes ocean, with no shore in between. Some lands have mysteries, such as locked doors that won’t open until certain objectives are achieved by the players.

This section is reserved for any additional rules I come up with. Overall I’d like to encourage as much freedom as possible. If the description of the environment seems a little vague, feel free to fill in the gaps with whatever seems reasonable.
My only real complaint is that everyone hates one line chapters. I'm not saying that they are forbidden, just keep them to a minimum.
Also, respect the (Reserved) signs.

Recent change: we allow vore now.
